content.html:
Activity

Recall the process of dividing \(960 \div 20\) as a class using long division. Use this same method to divide the polynomials below.


  1. Find the quotient using long division.

    \((m^2+9m+20) \div (m+4)\)

Write down your answer. Then select the Solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(m + 5\);

\[\begin{array}{l}m + 4\mathop{\left){\vphantom{1{{m^2} + 9m + 20}}}\right.
\!\!\!\!\overline{\,\,\,\vphantom 1{{{m^2} + 9m + 20}}}}
\limits^{\displaystyle\,\,\, {m\,\, + \,\,5}}\\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\underline { - ({m^2} + 4m)} \\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,5m + 20\\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\underline {\, - (5m + 20)} \\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,0\end{array}\]



  1. Find the quotient using long division.

    \((p^2+2p-8) \div (p^2-7p+10)\)

Write down your answer. Then select the Solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(1+ \frac{9p-18}{p^2-7p+10}\)



  1. Find the quotient using long division.

    \((5x+5) \div (x+5)\)

Write down your answer. Then select the Solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(5- \frac{20}{x+5}\)


Notice in the next problem, there is no \(x^3\) term in the dividend. Add \(0x^3\) as a placeholder when using long division.


  1. Find the quotient using long division.

    \((x^4-11x^2-7x-6) \div (x+3)\)

Write down your answer. Then select the Solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(x^3-3x^2-2x-1-\frac{3}{x+3}\)


In this next problem, you will need to add two placeholders to divide.


  1. Find the quotient using long division.

    \((125x^3-8) \div (5x-2)\)

Write down your answer. Then select the Solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

 \(25x^2+10x+4\)



Extending Your Thinking

Find the quotient using long division.

\((125y^5-80y^4-31y^3+37y^2+10y-24) \div (5y-4)\)

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

\(25y^4+4y^3-3y^2+5y+6\);

\[\begin{array}{l}5y - 4\mathop{\left){\vphantom{1{125{y^5} - 80{y^4} - 31{y^3} + 37{y^2} + 10y - 24}}}\right.
\!\!\!\!\overline{\,\,\,\vphantom 1{{125{y^5} - 80{y^4} - 31{y^3} + 37{y^2} + 10y - 24}}}}
\limits^{\displaystyle\,\,\, {25{y^4} + \,\,\,4{y^3}\,\, - \,\,3{y^2}\,\, + \,\,5y\,\,\, + \,\,6\,}}\\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\underline { - (125{y^5} - 100{y^4})} \\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,20{y^4} - 31{y^3}\\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\underline { - (20{y^4} - 16{y^3})} \\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, - \,15{y^3} + 37{y^2}\\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\underline { - ( - \,15{y^3} + 12{y^2})} \\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,25{y^2} + 10y\\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\underline { - (25{y^2} - 20y)} \\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,30y - 24\\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\underline { - (30y - 24)} \\\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,0\end{array}\]


Video: Dividing Polynomials Using Long Division

Watch the following video to learn more about how to divide polynomials using long division.
